header.title: XQuery and XPath Functions and Operators Math Namespace Document

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p:
This document describes the namespace &nsname; defined by the
specification (&fo.spec.date.month; &fo.spec.date.year; version). This namespace is identified by the namespace prefix math:, which is not a predefined prefix. For updated information, please refer to the latest version of the specification.

This document describes the names that are defined in this namespace at the time of publication. The W3C reserves the right to define additional names in this namespace in the future.
is the only specification that may amend this namespace.
This document contains a directory of links to related resources, using RDDL (as defined in ).
It is GRDDL-enabled (as defined in ), that is to say that a GRDDL-compliant processor can extract useful RDF (as defined in ) representations of the information contained herein.

div1.head: XQuery and XPath Math Functions
div1.p: This section lists all of the functions defined by the specification to be in the namespace reserved for certain mathematical functions. Each function is uniquely identified with a URI of the form: “&nsname;#name” where name is the name of a function, such as “sqrt”: &nsname;#sqrt.

The normative definitions of these functions are in the specification. For convenience, a very brief, non-normative summary of each function is provided. For details, follow the link on the “Summary:” introductory text below each function.

div1.head: Normative References
div1.p: These documents describe the names that are defined in this namespace at the time of publication. The W3C reserves the right to define additional names in this namespace in the future.
